intro: Babiana melanops, commonly known as the black-eyed babiana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. Babiana melanops is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to Mediterranean climates.
